article.headline: Hartford 69, Maine 62
article.story: ORONO, Maine (AP) -- Aaron Cook scored a career-high 40 points Thursday, including eight three-pointers as Hartford overcame a double-digit second half deficit to beat Maine, 69-62. Cook hit a three-pointer with 8 minutes left to tie the game at 53 and then buried back-to-back triples minutes later to give Hartford (8-12, 4-5 America East) a 61-57 lead, its first since early in the first half. Rashard Turner led Maine (9-12, 4-6 America East) with 24 points, but it couldn't hold double digit leads in each half. Maine lead 19-8 to start and led by as many as 13 points in the first half. Hartford's Kenny Adeleke, America East's leading scorer and rebounder, was held to eight points, all in the second half. Cook picked up the slack offensively, hitting 8-11 from behind the arc. He scored 12 of his team's first 14 points and had 22 in the first half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
